overview_of_class: This course is designed to teach students the basics of single variable calculus, probability, set theory, random variables, and hypothesis testing. The course prepares students for the next class in the statistics sequence. The fundamental math used in this course will be covered in a review course prior to the start of the quarter. By the end of the course, students will understand the intuition behind statistical analysis, have practice applying the statistical techniques covered, and be familiar with different types of statistical anlysis.
name: Introduction to Statistics & Statistical Software
title: WCAS SOCIOL 400-0-20 Introduction to Statistics & Statistical Software

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is designed to teach students the basics of single variable calculus, probability, set theory, random variables, and hypothesis testing. The course prepares students for the next class in the statistics sequence. The fundamental math used in this course will be covered in a review course prior to the start of the quarter. By the end of the course, students will understand the intuition behind statistical analysis, have practice applying the statistical techniques covered, and be familiar with different types of statistical anlysis.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Understand relationship between calculus and probability (PDF, CDF), conduct tests on measures of association, conduct hypothesis tests

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Statistical Methods for the Social Sciences. Students may select either the 5th edition (Agresti) or 4th edition (Agresti & Finlay)

subject: SOCIOL
